column1: Súriquessë is the Elvish name of a grass.
column2: pp. 197-8The name appears on unpublished drawings related to  an illustration (fig. 196) by J.R.R. Tolkien depicting the grass; Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull describes the physical appearance of the grass as a "tuft of radiating grass".

column1: The name likely means "wind feather". It has been suggested that the name is Quenya
column3: "http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm Quettaparma Quenyallo" (accessed 7 June 2011) and would derive from súre and quesse.
